nl.vu.ip
Class BankClient

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--nl.vu.ip.BankClient
public class BankClient
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the interface to the bank server and uses sockets and the bank's own protocol to do money transfers and to verify earlier transfers.
The protocol uses structure-like messages to communicate between client and bank. The protocol's wire format is documented in a separate file.

Author:
Erik van Zijst - erik@prutser.cx - 07.apr.2003

Method Detail

bank_pay

public static int bank_pay(java.lang.String bankAddress,
                           int bankPort,
                           int src,
                           int dest,
                           float amount)
                    throws java.io.IOException
This method is used to transfer money from one bank account to the other. It takes the location information of the bank server, as well as the accounts and amount to transfer and sends a serializes message to the bank using TCP sockets.
The protocol's wire format is documented in a separate file.

Parameters:
bankAddress - the hostname or IP address of the bank server.
bankPort - the remote port the bank server is listening to.
src - the bank account to withdraw the money from.
dest - the destination bank account.
amount - the amount of money to transfer.
Returns:
the certificate of the money transfer.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a communication problem.

bank_check

public static int bank_check(java.lang.String bankAddress,
                             int bankPort,
                             int src,
                             int dest,
                             float amount,
                             int certificate)
                      throws java.io.IOException
This method is used to verify an earlier money transfer. Given all the transaction's properties such as bank accounts and amount, together with the transaction certificate that the bank generated, this method contacts the bank and lets the bank verify whether the described transaction was indeed executed earlier.
The protocol's wire format is documented in a separate file.

Parameters:
bankAddress - the hostname or IP address of the bank server.
bankPort - the remote port the bank server is listening to.
src - the bank account the money was withdrawn from.
dest - the destination bank account.
amount - the amount of money transferred.
certificate - the certificate that was generated at time of the transaction.
Returns:
0 if the described transaction is indeed a vaild one, -1 otherwise.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a communication problem.
